intro: Seseli laticalycinum, commonly known as the Narrow-leaved Seseli, is a flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale purple flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Seseli laticalycinum is often found in the Mediterranean region and parts of southern Europe.
